pr_title: Add probability to decision when appropriate

timeline.message: add the sampling probability to the decision, when appropriate.

timeline.bodyText: All other semantic conventions use a prefix followed by a dot and underscores instead of camelCase (e.g. messaging.protocol_version). So a better name would probably be probability_sampler.probability.
timeline.author: Oberon00

replies.bodyText: Or just sampler.probability if we intend to have this cross samplers.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: yeah, I was just throwing something in there to start this discussion!  Agree this should be something in the semantic conventions. Should we put this PR on hold while that gets done? @pavolloffay as the original requester, can you create an issue in the spec repo and get the ball rolling?
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: I went ahead and put in a PR with sampling.probability as the attribute name. open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification#570.
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: To be more java we should use getAttributes in the Decision class I think.
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: I agree. Should I make that part of this PR, or create an issue for it?
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: up to you, happy to review that in this PR.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.message: normalize a method name and move attribute to semantic convention attributes

timeline.bodyText: I would put this in the SDK since it is SDK specific.
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: It's probably also useful for vendor API implementations though.
replies.author: Oberon00

replies.bodyText: Can you give an example of how an API user would want to use this attribute?
replies.author: jkwatson
bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: Yes, strong agree. I'll make it happen.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: @jkwatson I think an API user won't use this attribute (except if you use the API package at the backend, then you could use it to read the attribute back from the exported span), but implementers that want to be compatible with the official SDK in that regard could use it.
replies.author: Oberon00

replies.bodyText: I see. Do you think there's a whole class of stuff that an alternate SDK implementation would want to use from the default SDK?
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText:
Even if that is the case, I am not sure we can have this in the API: Sampler is not part of the API (and explicitly removed from the API any "sampling" logic).
So I think this should be moved to SDK anyway.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: I was just wondering if there was going to be a need for some sort of "SDK Support" module that could contain this kind of thing. I'm not suggesting we do that now, though. :)
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification#570 for the spec change
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: ok, moved into the SDK. PTAL, @bogdandrutu
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.message: move the sampling attribute to its own class in the SDK

timeline.bodyText: As I mentioned in a previous comment, I would make this internal in the Samplers until a decision in the specs is made. I think this was the confusion from the other thread, but would not expose it for the moment, my comment there was that if we decide to expose it will definitely not going to be in the API.
